div.p: Especially getting this work, getting this position I’m in at the moment having to achieve my National Diploma Level 3
which previously I failed and kind of wanted to do it again and I did a triple merit grade which shocked everybody and again going back to school
I never thought I would get 8 A-Cs you know I was happy to get Ds but you know when you have your future in the hands of somebody else
that’s very difficult you know and then when a final decision was made for me to be accepted as a permanent of this country that was
there because at the time I just lost my brother, my brother had died at the time and it was very difficult for me to deal with at the same time
not being able to see you know because we were very close and a month later I got an answer saying that I’ve been accepted and permanent
to this country and I forgot the most important thing is going back home, being able to go back home you know see my family again after 9 years
you know that was the most significant to me you know career is where you, as in career-wise I’m really happy with what I’ve achieved
and you know very overwhelmed and very... it’s because that was up to me it's how far I can push myself you know
